Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk mgetty
exit 0

exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: mgetty bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description:
Updated mgetty packages that fix two bugs are now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. The mgetty packages contain a modem getty utility that allows logins over a serial line, for example using a modem. If you are using a Class 2 or Class 2.0 modem, mgetty can receive faxes. The mgetty-sendfax package is required to send faxes.
This update fixes the following bugs:
* Previously, the "vgetty@.service" and "mgetty@.service" files included the "WantedBy=getty@.target" string, which incorrectly contained an at sign (@). As a consequence, the vgetty and mgetty services were enabled under a wrong target and failed to start on reboot. This update removes the at sign from the files, and vgetty and mgetty now run correctly after reboot if the services are enabled. (BZ#1127898)
* Prior to this update, a conflict between the hylafax+ packages and the mgetty packages was mistakenly indicated. Consequently, the user could not install both packages at the same time. With this update, the conflict is now correctly indicated between the hylafax+ and mgetty-sendfax packages instead of mgetty. As a result, hylafax+ and mgetty can now be installed at the same time as expected. Please note that hylafax+ is not a part of Red Hat Enterprise Linux, but it is included in Extra Packages for Enterprise Linux (EPEL). (BZ#1129054)
Users of mgetty are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs.
Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
